grades.description: Our Grade R program provides a play-based introduction to formal schooling, focusing on foundational skills development. Through structured play, children develop early literacy, numeracy, and social-emotional skills that prepare them for Grade 1.
key_focus: Fine and gross motor skill development
Creative expression through art, music, and movement
grades.highlight: Children explore learning through themed units that integrate all learning areas in an engaging, hands-on environment.

grades.description: Grade 1 marks the transition to formal learning with a strong emphasis on literacy and numeracy foundations. Students begin reading, writing, and basic mathematical operations while continuing to develop through play-based activities.
key_focus: Continued development of fine motor skills
grades.highlight: The reading journey begins in earnest with systematic phonics instruction and guided reading groups.

grades.description: In Grade 2, students build on their foundational skills with more complex reading, writing, and mathematical concepts. There is an increased focus on comprehension, creative writing, and problem-solving.
grades.highlight: Students begin writing their own stories and solving more complex mathematical problems.

grades.description: Grade 3 completes the Foundation Phase, consolidating literacy and numeracy skills in preparation for the Intermediate Phase. Students develop greater independence and critical thinking skills.
grades.highlight: The culmination of Foundation Phase includes standardized assessments to ensure readiness for Grade 4.

grades.description: Grade 4 marks the beginning of the Intermediate Phase, with a transition to subject-specific learning. Students encounter more complex content across subjects and develop stronger analytical skills.
grades.highlight: Students begin using textbooks and specialized materials for different subjects.

grades.description: In Grade 5, the curriculum expands with more detailed content in each subject area. Students develop stronger research skills and begin more substantive project work.
grades.highlight: Project-based learning becomes more prominent, encouraging deeper exploration of topics.

grades.description: Grade 6 continues building on subject knowledge with increased academic rigor. Students develop stronger critical thinking skills and begin to make connections between different subject areas.
key_focus: Advanced reading and writing across genres
Systems of the human body and earth sciences
grades.highlight: Interdisciplinary projects connect learning across different subject areas.

grades.description: As the final year of primary school, Grade 7 prepares students for the transition to high school. The curriculum focuses on consolidating knowledge and developing the skills needed for future academic success.
key_focus: Critical analysis of texts and media
grades.highlight: Grade 7 culminates with a capstone project that demonstrates mastery of skills across subject areas.
